blocks.name: mersenne
blocks.content: A Mersenne prime is a prime number of the form ` 2 ^ P - 1 ` . This theorem shows that the ` P ` in this expression is necessarily also prime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: perfect
blocks.content: The Euclid-Euler theorem, or Perfect Number theorem. A positive even integer ` N ` is a perfect number (that is, its divisor sum is ` 2 N ` ) if and only if it is of the form ` 2 ^ ( p - 1 ) x. ( 2 ^ p - 1 ) ` , where ` 2 ^ p - 1 ` is prime (a Mersenne prime). (It follows from this that ` p ` is also prime.) This is Metamath 100 proof #70. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
